thread.title: Alzheimer's All-Star Classic set for Saturday at Brentwood HIgh School
thread.title_full: Alzheimer's All-Star Classic set for Saturday at Brentwood HIgh School | Newsday

author: BOB HERZOG
title: Alzheimer's All-Star Classic set for Saturday at Brentwood HIgh School
text:
Brentwood teammates and returning Newsday All-Long Island first-team selections Mike Almonacy and Jamel Allen headline the Suffolk County boys team that will face Nassau County in the 6th Alzheimer's All-Star Basketball Classic on Saturday at Brentwood High School.
Allen, a high-flying forward, and Almonacy, a multipurpose guard, have led Brentwood to back-to-back Long Island championships and trips to the state tournament in Glens Falls. Almonacy already has committed to Stony Brook.
Latest HS sports stories Esposito's two diving goals boost Miller Place Spalding helps save the day for Glenn Baseball field to be named for LI coach ESM's Bukzin takes Division IV tennis title Callejas' 'instant' goal holds up for Brentwood Devonte Green of Long Island Lutheran, also a Newsday All-Long Island first-team selection last season, leads the Nassau team that includes three other LuHi players. Green, a high-scoring guard and brother of San Antonio Spurs sharpshooter Danny Green, had considered transferring to Brewster Academy in New Hampshire, but changed his mind.
Three Newsday All-Long Island second-team choices will play in the boys game, which begins at 5 p.m.: Lukas Jarrett (Northport) and Israel Johnson (Southampton) for Suffolk and Alex Sorenson (South Side) for Nassau.
Four Newsday All-Long Island second-team selections will participate in the girls game, which begins at 3 p.m., also at Brentwood High. They are: Kaela Hilaire (Floral Park) and Aziah Hudson (Baldwin) for Nassau, and Alexa Fotopolous (Hampton Bays) and Taylor Goode (St. Anthony's) for Suffolk.
Admission is $10 and proceeds will be donated to the Alzheimer's Association of Long Island.
